answers.author: [Unknown]
answers.text:
Hi Gregory, 
This sounds like a pretty new business! Creating mobile pubs that bike around cities isn't something I have ever seen before. Unfortunately we do not have anything directly addressing pedal pubs yet on the Knowledge Network although I'm sure as they grow in popularity we will start getting resources. I was able to find a previously asked question that deals with open container laws and outdoor patio seating. Your city may be able to count the pedal pubs in a similar way to bar patios. http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/kn/Question/21928
I hope your member finds this useful and that when they create their own plan they add it to the Knowledge Network!
Best, 
Robin Saywitz
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern 
rsaywitz@icma.org

Trolley Pub made some headlines last year in Arlington VA, and it also operates in Raleigh NC. I heard about it but am not familiar with the regulations. One set of regs relates to the unusual vehicle --is it most like a taxi? Another set has to do with alcohol in public --is it like a patio?
http://www.trolleypub.com/

author: Gregory Stopka
text:
I have a member that is interested in learning about local governments that have pedal pubs.  Do you have an ordinance regulating them?  Have you faced any problems?  Any information you could provide would be greatly appreciated.
Thanks,
Greg Stopka
Central Regional Director
